intro: Pipturus angustifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaved holly, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in suitable climates.
